isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - ENGINE COOLANT LEVEL SYSTEM - PLASTIC SURGE TANKS

svcproc.title: PLASTIC SURGE TANKS
svcproc.para: Plastic surge tanks use a floating ball with a magnet and magnetic switch. With the coolant level full, the float will raise and the magnet will pull the level switch open. This will allow for 12 volts to be present at pin 10 of the ECM. If the level should go low, the switch will close and pin 10 of the ECM would go to 0 volts. The ECM must be programmed for a plastic tank for this coolant level switch to operate properly.
